item.title: Kubernetes 简化版：了解其内部工作原理

description.p: 除了这些与 Kubernetes 集群直接相关的组件外，值得一提的是“Kubectl”工具。
Kubectl 作为与集群交互的主要命令行界面，使用户能够执行命令、管理资源并获取有关集群状态的信息。
为了更好地理解 Kubernetes 的各个部分如何协同工作，让我们逐步研究在集群中创建新 pod 的过程。
description.h2: 第 1 步：用户请求处理
description.p: 当用户想要在 Kubernetes 中创建新的 pod 时，他们首先通过 kubectl 命令行工具发出命令。 此命令传送到 kube-apiserver，它作为集群内通信的中心枢纽起着至关重要的作用。然后 kube-apiserver 验证用户请求，确保其完整性和安全性。如果验证成功，kube-apiserver 会继续在 etcd 存储系统中为 pod 创建一个新的键值记录。

item.title: Design guidelines for non-designers: Make your product stand out

description.h4: Here’s how you can apply this guideline:
description.p: The web today is extremely mature, so use that to your advantage. Look to brands that are similar to yours and ones that you admire for inspiration. How are their landing pages structured? Stick to common elements like tabs, toggles, dropdowns, primary/secondary buttons, etc.
This point goes back to simplicity and is especially important in user onboarding. If something within your product onboarding causes any confusion, your users will feel frustrated.
If customers cannot complete their tasks in your product, they're not reaching the value they want. This will lead to churn.
How can you prevent that? Remove distractions and focus on helping them complete their task. Decrease the chance that they could make any mistakes.
